
```{r ScatterplotDescriptionExamples, name="ScatterExamples", echo=FALSE,fig.width=6, fig.height=6, fig.align="center", out.width='100%',fig.cap="Some example scatterplots. The grey lines show the overall relationship between the variables."}
par( mfrow = c(2, 3),
     omi = c(0, 0, 0, 0) + 0.1) # OUTSIDE margins


plot.colour <- grey(0.3)
 
set.seed(2300)
x <- runif(50, 
           min = 0, 
           max = 10)
y <- (2 * x) + 5 + rnorm( length(x), 0, 1)

par(  mar = c(5, 3.75, 4, 1) + 0.1) # DEFAULT: c(5, 4, 4, 2) + 0.1.
plot( y ~ x,
      pch = 19,
      las = 1,
      ylim = c(0, 30),
      xlab = "Explanatory var",
      ylab = "Response",
      main = "Scatterplot A"
)
abline( coef(lm( y ~ x )), 
        lwd = 2, 
       col = plot.colour)

text(0, 25, 
     pos = 4,
     "Form: linear\nDirection: positive\nVariation: small")

set.seed(2300)
x <- runif(50, 
           min = 0, 
           max = 10)
y <- -2 * (x - 4)^2 + 5 + rnorm( length(x), 0, 5) + 80

par(  mar = c(5, 3.75, 4, 1) + 0.1) # DEFAULT: c(5, 4, 4, 2) + 0.1.

plot( y ~ x,
      pch = 19,
      las = 1,
      ylim = c(0, 100),
      xlab = "Explanatory var",
      ylab = "Response",
      main = "Scatterplot C"
)
mod.curve <- lm( y ~ poly(x, 2) )

xnew <- seq(0, 10, 
            length = 25)
newdata <- data.frame(x = xnew)
ynew <- predict( mod.curve, 
                 newdata = newdata)

lines( ynew ~ xnew, 
       lwd = 2, 
       col = plot.colour)

text(-0.2, 13, 
     pos = 4,
     "Form: Curved\nDirection: not relevant\nVariation: small")
